Simulates n data sets and performs bootstrapping

Source: R/sim_single_opt_ar2.R
sim_single_opt_ar2.Rd

Performs n tests

Usage

sim_single_opt_ar2(
  beta = 0,
  rho1 = 0,
  rho2 = 0,
  sigma = 0.25,
  nT = 10,
  nSims = 200,
  nBootSims = 500
)

Arguments

beta

Numeric. Values for beta_1 (slope/trend parameter)

sigma

Numeric. Values of standard deviation of noise

nT

Numeric. Values for the length of time series to simulate

nSims

Numeric. Number of time series to simulate

nBootSims

Numeric. Number of bootstrap data sets

rho

Numeric Values for autoregressive parameter

Details

For convenience the intercept, beta_0 is set to zero

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
sim_single_opt(beta = 0.5,rho =0.5, sigma = 0.25, nT = 10,
nSims = 200, nBootSims = 500)
} # }
